title: Torque and work - rank work from tau-theta graphs

content.question: The four graphs show the net torque <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math> exerted on four identical rotating disks as a function of each disk’s angular position <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math>. Which of the following ranks the magnitude <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> of the work done on each disk as the disks rotate from <math alttext="theta equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> radians to <math alttext="theta equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math> radians?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub 3 is greater than W sub 2, which is greater than W sub 4, which is greater than W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="W sub 3 equals W sub 4, which is greater than W sub 1, which is greater than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="W sub 3 equals W sub 4, which is greater than W sub 2, which is greater than W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="W sub 4 is greater than W sub 1, which equals W sub 2, which equals W sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub 4 is greater than W sub 1, which equals W sub 2, which equals W sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
